programme.title: Extinct or Alive
programme.desc: Forrest is in the Galapagos seeking the Fernandina Tortoise, an animal that was only seen once, over 100 years ago. The clues are here, along with an abundance of incredibly unique species, raising hopes of a historic discovery.

programme.title: Extinct or Alive
programme.desc: Forrest sets off on a dangerous, shark-infested search for the extinct Caribbean monk seal. To prove its existence, he and the crew descend into deep waters where they come face-to-face with a giant tiger shark.

programme.title: Extinct or Alive
programme.desc: In Vietnam, Forrest teams up with a conservation group to save the largest turtle species in the world from extinction. Using cutting edge technology, they attempt to find a suitor for the last and only surviving giant softshell.

programme.title: Extinct or Alive
programme.desc: Known for being a pint-size version of its African cousin, the Malagasy dwarf hippo has been written off as extinct for 1000 years. Forrest and a local biologist to trek through the bush of Madagascar to prove it still survives.

programme.title: Extinct or Alive
programme.desc: Forrest is determined to find out if the famously reclusive Ivory Billed Woodpecker still exists. The alligator and poisonous snake infested swamps of Louisiana make for a challenging mission, but he is prepared for anything.

programme.title: Extinct or Alive
programme.desc: Forrest travels to the Faroe Islands to look for any trace of the Great Auk. The search takes him through some of the most scenic and rugged terrain he's ever attempted in his passionate search for a large flightless seabird that has been long forgotten.

programme.title: Extinct or Alive
programme.desc: Declared extinct only recently, Forrest is tracking clues and eyewitness accounts that suggest that the Formosan Clouded Leopard could still be alive. He treks deep into the jungles of Taiwan where a run-in with a predator might just solve a mystery.

programme.title: Extinct or Alive
programme.desc: Forrest sets out on a history-making expedition in Zanzibar, revealing species that have never before been filmed. He captures evidence that leads to an unforgettable conclusion on the Zanzibar Leopard, an animal that was declared extinct 25 years ago.

programme.title: A Veteran's Christmas
programme.desc: After a veteran returns home, she meets and falls in love with a judge when her car breaks down. They both must make a career choice if they want to stay together.

programme.title: Christmas in Evergreen: Bells Are Ringing
programme.desc: As her wedding approaches, a woman steps up to help launch a new museum, all while questioning if marrying her fiancé is the right choice.

programme.title: Christmas She Wrote
programme.desc: A romance writer has her column cancelled right before Christmas, so she heads home to reconnect with her family and sparks some romance of her own.

programme.title: A Christmas Detour
programme.desc: Two NYC-bound travellers find themselves linked when a storm waylays their flight to an airport hotel in Buffalo. Desperate to get home in time for Christmas, a woman seeks help, in any form, to make a Christmas miracle happen.

programme.title: Finding Santa
programme.desc: When the Santa who stars in their annual holiday parade falls off his sleigh and injures himself, a woman must go on a quest to find the perfect Santa.

programme.title: Heart of the Holidays
programme.desc: A career-driven woman returns to her hometown for the holidays and faces her high-school boyfriend. Together, they rediscover what matters most in life.

programme.title: Miss Christmas
programme.desc: Nicknamed 'Miss Christmas,' the official tree finder for the Radcliffee tree lighting, is left desperate to find the perfect tree. A letter sends her to a small town and a man who doesn't want to part with this tree.

programme.title: The Christmas Cottage
programme.desc: An interior designer is made-of-honour at her friend’s wedding. Before the big day, she ends up stranded in the Christmas Cottage, where rumour has it, all guests will find everlasting love, with the brother of the bride.

programme.title: Home and Family
programme.desc: Marilu Henner, Autumn Reeser, Antonio Cupo and Michael Xaiver are today's guests.

programme.title: Christmas at Dollywood
programme.desc: When a NYC event planner returns to Tennessee to plan the Christmas celebration at Dollywood, she's paired with the head of operations who thinks he can handle the party just fine on his own.

programme.title: Christmas in Vienna
programme.desc: A concert violinist who has lost her passion visits Vienna for Christmas. There she finds the inspiration she has been missing with an American diplomat and his children.

programme.title: Christmas at Holly Lodge
programme.desc: A woman inherits the Evergreen Inn and Ski Lodge from her parents and starts a new tradition of spending every holiday there. While visiting she meets a family that will change her life.

programme.title: Christmas with the Darlings
programme.desc: When an assistant gives her final notice, she is drawn into helping the charming, younger brother of her wealthy boss as he looks after his orphaned nieces and nephew through Christmas.

programme.title: Five Star Christmas
programme.desc: When a travel writer shows up unexpectedly at their dad's B&B, the Ralston family all pretend to be guests in hopes of a good review.

programme.title: If I Only Had Christmas
programme.desc: At Christmas, a cheerful publicist teams up with a cynical VP and his eclectic team to help a charity in need.

programme.title: Christmas by Starlight
programme.desc: When her family's beloved eatery, The Starlight Café, is slated for demolition, Annie vows to put a stop to it before Christmas.

programme.title: Christmas Land
programme.desc: When a woman inherits a Christmas tree farm from her late grandmother, she decides the sensible thing to do is sell it. However, once she revisits the farm, she falls in love with the townspeople and the farm.

programme.title: My Christmas Love
programme.desc: A hopeless romantic who can't seem to give a guy a real chance begins receiving '12 Days of Christmas' gifts anonymously at door. She begins to believe that the mystery suitor could live up to her expectations.

programme.title: Christmas Joy
programme.desc: A woman must return to her hometown to care for her aunt during the Christmas break. While there, she meets a man and learns there is no place like home for the holidays.

programme.title: Coming Home for Christmas
programme.desc: While planning a final Christmas gala at the exquisite Ashford Estate, a house manager falls for the handsome executor of the estate.

programme.title: Christmas in Evergreen: Letters to Santa
programme.desc: A woman returns to her home town for Christmas and discovers that the town's historic general store has shut down. Using the skills she has as a retail designer, she is determined to bring the store back to life in time for the holidays.

programme.title: Christmas in Evergreen: Bells Are Ringing
programme.desc: As her wedding approaches, a woman steps up to help launch a new museum, all while questioning if marrying her fiancé is the right choice.

programme.desc: A woman falls in love with her liver donor, and his selfless gesture leads to a Christmas miracle for everyone.

programme.desc: Three inmates are said to have escaped from Alcatraz prison, but even today, it's never been proven. New evidence might finally crack this notorious cold case, as experts use forensic science and cutting-edge tech to investigate fresh leads.

programme.title: Mysteries of the Abandoned
programme.desc: Revealing how an alien Nazi structure that changed history, a strange Soviet monolith known as the Tower of Death, and a concrete ocean giant were built, and why they were abandoned.

programme.title: Mysteries of the Abandoned
programme.desc: An underground labyrinth once used by a secret police force could warp the mind and turn friend into foe.

programme.title: How the Universe Works
programme.desc: The first close-up images of Pluto revealed the unimaginable secrets of this mysterious frozen world. Now, scientists investigate if Pluto is home to a warm ocean of liquid water beneath its surface, and whether this underground ocean could harbor life.

programme.title: How the Universe Works
programme.desc: Nebulas are the strange structures of cosmic gas and dust where stars are born and die, and new discoveries reveal the secrets of these mysterious places.

programme.title: How the Universe Works
programme.desc: Giant magnetic bubbles millions of miles wide, bizarre invisible matter, and a death star tearing through bands of icy comets, flinging them into violent orbits. All this and more could be inside our cosmic backyard, and effecting our lives on Earth.

programme.title: How the Universe Works
programme.desc: Asteroids strike, planets collide, black holes blast out death rays, volcanoes erupt and ice engulfs the planet. These are the universe's weapons of extinction. They've happened before - wiping out entire species, and they will happen again.

programme.title: How the Universe Works
programme.desc: New research may now be able to answer the question that asks what built the Milky Way. In the very centre of our galaxy is an extremely large black hole that is one of the most destructive objects in the universe. This could possibly be the answer.

programme.title: How the Universe Works
programme.desc: Life once existed on Mars, but a series of devastating mass extinctions have made present-day life nearly impossible. The latest science shows how Martian life keeps bouncing back as it transforms from a blue watery world like Earth into a desert planet.

programme.title: The Truth Behind the Moon Landing
programme.desc: Some believe the fire on Apollo 1 that killed three astronauts was a top-secret cover-up, and a team of experts investigate if this disaster was a tragic accident or part of a conspiracy to fake the moon landing.

programme.title: The Truth Behind the Moon Landing
programme.desc: One of America's greatest achievements is also one of its most controversial, and now, a team of experts investigate if there was a conspiracy to fake the moon landing, uncovering a secret report on hundreds of Nazis' involved in the Apollo space program.

programme.title: The Truth Behind the Moon Landing
programme.desc: Confidential CIA files reveal a top-secret war for space between the US and the Soviets, and a team of experts investigate if new discoveries about American espionage during the Apollo program provide evidence of a conspiracy to fake the moon landing.

programme.title: The Truth Behind the Moon Landing
programme.desc: Apollo 11's lunar module nearly killed Neil Armstrong during training, and some believe this close-call could explain a conspiracy to fake the moon landing. A team of experts investigate if dangers that the Apollo 11 crew faced were motive for a cover-up.

programme.title: The Truth Behind the Moon Landing
programme.desc: Experts use cutting-edge tech to hunt for the lost NASA tapes that recorded the Apollo 11 moon landing and shed light on a possible conspiracy, as some believe their disappearance is part of a cover-up to hide the truth.

programme.title: The Truth Behind the Moon Landing
programme.desc: Some believe that the moon's waving American flag is the smoking gun that NASA faked the moon landing, and as a team of experts investigate this strange piece of evidence, the trail leads all the way to some of Hollywood's biggest names.

programme.title: Unearthed
programme.desc: Hadrian's Wall was built to guard the frontiers of the ancient Roman Empire. Now, discoveries reveal who the Romans were trying to keep out with this 72-mile-long megastructure, and what it tells us about the ancient people of Iron Age Britain.

programme.title: Unearthed
programme.desc: New discoveries at the lost city of Jericho offer fresh evidence about the biblical battle that brought its impregnable walls down. Using the latest tech, experts might reveal if Joshua and the Israelites really conquered this ancient city and how.

programme.title: Unearthed
programme.desc: The Iceman is the world's oldest and most perfectly preserved mummy, and brand-new cutting-edge forensic technology is revealing his darkest secrets; these discoveries could change everything we know about the humans who lived 5,000 years ago.

programme.title: Unearthed
programme.desc: A strange site called Saqqara is home to Egypt's very first pyramid, and here, experts use cutting-edge tech to reveal why the ancient Egyptians started building pyramids and if the mummified animals found here are evidence of a bizarre religious cult.

programme.title: Tomorrow's World Today
programme.desc: A look at advances in renewable resources.

programme.title: Tomorrow's World Today
programme.desc: Green buildings have worldwide attention, so George Davison sends Tamara Krinsky to investigate climate control using renewable resources.

programme.title: Egypt's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: The Crocodile Queen was Egypt's first female pharaoh, but we don't who she was, or why she took this sinister alter-ego. New discoveries might finally answer this ancient mystery, and more of Egypt's darkest secrets.

programme.title: Egypt's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: Explorers in search of a lost city built by Ramses II uncover startling evidence that reveals the extent of ancient Egypt's scientific knowledge, and the new discoveries at this strange site offer more clues to Egypt's darkest secrets.

programme.title: Egypt's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: Cataclysmic changes in ancient Egypt might have been caused by an extraordinary set of international phenomena, and the latest tech helps identify the supernatural culprit. What experts discover reveals a truth stranger than fiction.

programme.title: Egypt's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: When experts unearth a mysterious lost city built by an infamous pharaoh, they find clues of a grisly catastrophe. New discoveries reveal the apocalyptic events that turned this place into hell on earth, offering more clues to Egypt's darkest secrets.

programme.title: Egypt's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: Mysterious tomb carvings provide dark evidence that ancient Egyptians practiced cannibalism, but we don't know why. New discoveries might finally answer this ancient mystery, and experts use modern-day tech to reveal more of Egypt's darkest secrets.

programme.title: Egypt's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: New discoveries reveal the secrets of Egypt's tomb raiders, and what ancient Egyptians did to ensure the treasures of their dead pharaohs wouldn't be stolen. The latest science answers these great mysteries, shedding new light on Egypt's darkest secrets.

programme.title: Egypt's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: New evidence suggests that the mythological Scorpion King might have actually existed. New discoveries might answer this ancient mystery, and experts use modern-day tech to reveal more of Egypt's darkest secrets.

programme.title: Egypt's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: Scientists have spent years looking for the mummy of Nefertiti, one of ancient Egypt's most iconic pharaohs. The latest tech helps experts in their search, what they discover might reveal the shocking truth about how she died, and Egypt’s dark secrets.

programme.title: Egypt's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: New discoveries reveal if King Tut's tomb is indeed cursed, as it is said to have killed nine people. The latest science might finally answer this ancient mystery, and experts use modern-day tech to investigate more of Egypt's darkest secrets.

programme.title: Egypt's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: The Screaming Mummy is one of Egypt's greatest mysteries: a mummy with a terrifying expression frozen in agony. New discoveries reveal the connection between this horrific discovery and a pharaoh's murder, offering more clues to Egypt's darkest secrets.

programme.title: What on Earth?
programme.desc: A strange structure is found in the heartlands of Mongolia. Find out if it is the lost tomb of Genghis Khan. Bizarre rings in Spain could lead to the lost city of Atlantis and a huge floating island is on a collision course with New Zealand.

programme.title: What on Earth?
programme.desc: Expert historians uncover evidence of a mysterious and horrifying Nazi blitzkrieg which could rank as the worst atrocity of World War II.

programme.title: What on Earth?
programme.desc: Something strange in the Himalayas could be evidence of a top-secret CIA program to turn monks into killer agents, and cutting-edge science helps experts investigate the truth behind this mysterious anomaly.

programme.title: What on Earth?
programme.desc: A satellite spots a set of huge arrows in the badlands of the American west. A blood red waterfall stains Antarctica's snows. A plague of huge holes in the Siberian landscape.

programme.title: What on Earth?
programme.desc: A ghost ship with links to the mob suddenly appears on a California beach. Strange markings could be a coded message that reveals a plot to overthrow the Queen of England. A lake believed to have magical healing powers holds clues to life on Mars.
